lines.text: [to Johnny, who has a bad hangover]
You look like the tail end of a hard winter.
You keep out of my affairs! I'm tired of bein' the tail end of your kite.
[Johnny grabs an apple out of Linda's basket and takes a bite]
Put that back! I hope there's a worm in it.
[Johnny returns the half-eaten apple to Linda's basket and grabs another]
There was!
Why bother with him? You got everything he has last night.
Every little bit makes just a little bit more.
[Porter and his men count the proceeds from their latest robbery]
Well, I'll be danged. Nothing but old bills and receipts!
Why, the dirty crook!
[Shanghai forces Johnny to dig his own grave]
I know this is your grave, son, but if I was you, I'd make it a little longer.
Who's your father?
Charlie McHenry.
I reckon he's one of those nice people I haven't been meetin' lately.
You don't seem to know much, do you?
I'm not the one who's lost.
I'm going to do what I should have done a long time ago... I'm going to round up those crooks!
My father?
Maybe I'll look the other way when I see him.
What have you got there?
A little deposit from the Twin Rivers Bank.
Where'd you come from?
I sprouted angel's wings and flew!
More likely horns and a tail.
[Hoppy has emerged from a gunfight]
You okay, Hoppy?
Sure! Just smoked up a bit.
I guess I've been about the biggest fool in the world.
You're not the first, nor the last.
[last lines]
Well, Miss Linda, it looks like you'll need some help around here.
Just leave it to me, Hoppy!
That's just what I'm afraid of.
